class_notes:
LAT 314: Virgil
This course focuses on the close reading, textual analysis, and discussion of Virgil's Aeneid, one of the most influential and significant works of Latin poetry. Especial attention will be paid to poetic and narrative technique, his self-conscious position within the epic tradition, and how the text reflects or refracts contemporary socio-political contexts. Readings will be spread throughout the poem, allowing us to focus on passages of particular significance; the parts not read in Latin will be covered in translation. Assigned secondary scholarship will inform your understandings of the reading and provide a foundational basis for class discussion.
course_description: Reading of selected passages from the Eclogues, Georgics, or Aeneid, with discussion of poetic forms and strategies.
